creator: jvb@prairienet.org
text:
The canonical hostnames example in the Rewriting Guide does not work as written.
 I found that I need to change the regex's from "^/(.*)" to "^(.*)".  For
example, where the example shows 

    RewriteRule  ^/(.*)  http://fully.qualified.domain.name/$1  [L,R]

I had to use

    RewriteRule  ^(.*)  http://fully.qualified.domain.name/$1  [L,R]

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
The rewriting guide says explicitly, that the rules provided there are written
in order to work within the *server context* and you may have to change them
within directory context (which is, effectively within .htaccess files).

The regexps are valid there. However, the rewrite guide is not perfect and we
know that. But until someone writes something better, we have to stick with it :)

Thanks for using Apache.
